title: Update payment QR asset, remove header login control, and revise payment confirmation message

requirements.summary: Replace the payment QR image file used by the Payment Section while keeping the existing static asset path.
acceptanceCriteria: The QR shown in the payment UI matches the uploaded QR image.
The QR image is loaded from `/assets/generated/payment-qr.dim_512x512.png` and no backend image serving is introduced.
No code changes are required to reference a different QR path (only the asset file is replaced).

file_operations.description: Replace/update the static asset content with the user-provided uploaded QR image, keeping the same filename and path so existing UI references remain unchanged.

requirements.summary: Remove the Login/Logout icon/button from the landing page header UI rendered in App.tsx.
acceptanceCriteria: The header no longer renders the Login/Logout button and related icons (e.g., LogIn/LogOut).
The rest of the landing page layout remains intact and functional (offer details, urgency banner, form, payment flow).

file_operations.description: Remove the Login/Logout button from the header and clean up related imports/state/handlers (e.g., LogIn/LogOut imports and handleAuthToggle) while preserving the rest of the landing page flow and layout.

requirements.summary: Update the post-payment confirmation screen copy to prominently show the exact 10-minute access message after a successful mark-as-paid transition.
acceptanceCriteria: After a successful `markAsPaid` action, the confirmation screen displays the exact sentence: “You will get access within 10 mins after checking your payment details”.
The message is user-facing and clearly visible without needing to expand/click anything.
No other user-facing text contradicts the 10-minute access expectation.

file_operations.description: Update the confirmation copy so the exact sentence “You will get access within 10 mins after checking your payment details” is prominently displayed, and revise/remove any other visible text that implies longer timelines (e.g., 'within 24 hours') to avoid contradictions.
